timeline.author: Adam-
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -90,4 +90,21 @@ default boolean syncPanel()
 	{
 		return true;
 	}
+
+	@ConfigItem(
+		keyName = "ignoredEvents",
+		name = "Ignored groups",
+		description = "Configures which loot groups should be excluded from the panel UI"
+	)
+	default String getIgnoredEvents()

replies.bodyText:
I didn't hide this as the config option for hiding items is also not hidden.
I'm pretty sure having it hidden could cause issues with the limiting that would prevent someone from re-including an event.
replies.author: TheStonedTurtle

revised_code.chunk:
diff --git a/runelite-client/src/main/java/net/runelite/client/plugins/loottracker/LootTrackerConfig.java b/runelite-client/src/main/java/net/runelite/client/plugins/loottracker/LootTrackerConfig.java
index a8917ebfe..5ab78b159 100644
--- a/runelite-client/src/main/java/net/runelite/client/plugins/loottracker/LootTrackerConfig.java
+++ b/runelite-client/src/main/java/net/runelite/client/plugins/loottracker/LootTrackerConfig.java

@@ -90,21 +90,4 @@ public interface LootTrackerConfig extends Config
 	{
 		return true;
 	}
-
-	@ConfigItem(
-		keyName = "ignoredEvents",
-		name = "Ignored groups",
-		description = "Configures which loot groups should be excluded from the panel UI"
-	)
-	default String getIgnoredEvents()
-	{
-		return "";
-	}
-
-	@ConfigItem(
-		keyName = "ignoredEvents",
-		name = "",
-		description = ""
-	)
-	void setIgnoredEvents(String key);
 }
\ No newline at end of file

timeline.bodyText: If the config item for this is not actually going to be hidden, this will cause it to reorder itself randomly which seems not great
timeline.author: Adam-

replies.bodyText:
How would I prevent this re-ordering itself?
This method is a copy/paste of the existing toggleItem method which is also not hidden in the config panel, so it must have the same issue.
replies.author: TheStonedTurtle

timeline.bodyText: You could probably just make this reverse() + limit + forEach(buildBox)
timeline.author: Adam-

timeline.message: loottracker - add ability to ignore loot events

timeline.bodyText: I would maybe add a comment indicating why this is checking ignored (since buildBox also checks which looks unnecessary) as it is subtle.
timeline.author: Adam-

revised_code.chunk:
diff --git a/runelite-client/src/main/java/net/runelite/client/plugins/loottracker/LootTrackerPanel.java b/runelite-client/src/main/java/net/runelite/client/plugins/loottracker/LootTrackerPanel.java
index 4d8b0a1a7..7fb29230f 100644
--- a/runelite-client/src/main/java/net/runelite/client/plugins/loottracker/LootTrackerPanel.java
+++ b/runelite-client/src/main/java/net/runelite/client/plugins/loottracker/LootTrackerPanel.java

@@ -458,6 +458,8 @@ class LootTrackerPanel extends PluginPanel
 		{
 			sessionRecords.stream()
 				.sorted(Collections.reverseOrder())
+				// Visibility of hidden events uses the same flag as hidden items
+				// If they are not hiding ignored items we should include ignored events
 				.filter(r -> !hideIgnoredItems || !plugin.isEventIgnored(r.getTitle()))
 				.limit(MAX_LOOT_BOXES)
 				.forEach(this::buildBox);

timeline.bodyText: Just call isEventIgnored once and store the result
timeline.author: Adam-

replies.bodyText:
I don't understand what you are asking for me to change exactly.
I did notice LootTrackerBox could just use the ignoredEvent flag locally instead of storing the result, did you mean this?
replies.author: TheStonedTurtle

replies.bodyText: isEventIgnored is called on L485 and again here on L510. You can just call it once and store the result in a variable.
replies.author: Adam-

timeline.bodyText: additionally fix toggleItem to not randomly reorder things too
timeline.author: Adam-
